channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report X-2023120469
item.description:
Report X-2023120469

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: DOTHAN
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA found a HazMat package with four plastic gallon bottles of the Hypochlorite Solution damaged as it was coming on the rollers of Belt 4. QA removed it and brought to QA to secure and process. DescribePack: The cap failed due to it coming loose. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: QA promptly removed from Belt 4 and brought it to QA cage.

item.title: Report E-2023120098
item.description:
Report E-2023120098

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill of "Stovepaint Heat Resistant Silicone Coating" UN1263 Flammable Paint, 3, PGII, about 10 fluid ounces was spilled onto the trailer because there was no dunnage on top of the container when another piece of freight was loaded onto the 5gal metal drum that the product shipped in, which caused a pierce to the top, allowing the release. The improper loading happened at the XNW terminal. Upon review of the SDS, it was determined that the terminal staff could comfortably clean the spill by donning skin and eye PPE, avoiding all ignition sources, and not eating/drinking/smoking near the spill. The wasted product, absorbents used, and the damaged container will all be held in a 20-gallon poly drum as waste onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG CAME TO DAMAGE TABLE NEEDING INSPECTING DUE TO PKG BEING WET. PKG WAS PLACED IN TOTE AND TAKEN TO HAZMAT CAGE DescribePack: 5 GALLON PAIL WAS LEAKING FROM TOP OF LID. THERE WERE WAS HOLE THAT WAS NOT COVERED THAT IT WAS LEAKING FROM DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PKG WAS PLACED IN A TOTE AND TAKEN TO HAZMAT CAGE

item.title: Report X-2023110459
item.description:
Report X-2023110459

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: Homewood
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Inner contents: 8 plastic bottles @ 1000 ml each (2 leaked due to lose tops), 2 small bottles @ 70 ml each (no release). All bottles are labeled as: Samples 28 Diesel Truck or Diesel Truck Offload. The packing slip indicates a flashpoint of 136.8 F/ SNG25514-0016 (Vogtle 1&2)

item.title: Report X-2023110353
item.description:
Report X-2023110353

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: MUSCLE SHOALS
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Norfolk Southern
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: NS personnel reported an odor around tank car ETCX630519. Upon inspection by a contractor, the odor was indicated as coming from the manway using air monitoring equipment. The manway was opened and the manway gasket was found to be deteriorated. The manway gasket was replaced and the car resumed transit to destination.

item.title: Report X-2023110354
item.description:
Report X-2023110354

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-29
  • City: MUSCLE SHOALS
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Norfolk Southern
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: NS personnel reported tank car CIMX1034 leaking from the top of the car during switching. Upon inspection by a contractor the leak was found to be coming from the PRD. The leak was the result of a blown rupture disc. The rupture disc was replaced.
